episodes.title: Fan theories
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob comes up with alternative theories about hit movies and television shows, because that's how you know you've got a hit TV show or movie, because audiences insist on rewriting it totally.

episodes.title: Show running
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob offers a depressing, comparison between being the executive producer of a television show, being an executive producer of a television show, and being president of the United States.

episodes.title: What's new
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob offers a soothing way to ring in 2017.

episodes.title: My Friend's Place, 2016
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob take a break from complaining about everything and worrying about stuff he can't change and does something meaningful and concrete -- and then goes right back to the complaining and worrying.

episodes.title: Fine Tobacco
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Today's celebrities try to sell you wine and cigarettes and hair products and low calorie beer. Also Studebakers and toxic breath freshener. In other words, it's hard to be a celebrity pitchperson

episodes.title: Sorcerer
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob comes up with a better and more movie-star name for Benedict Cumberbatch. Archie Leach became Cary Grant; Frances Gumm became Judy Garland, and Benedict Cumberbatch should become Batch Benjamin. Otherwise he'll never make it big.

episodes.title: Stats
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob makes a glancing but significant reference to the election results, but promises not to talk politics. Instead, he talks politics-adjacent.

episodes.title: Thanksgiving
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: This holiday season, Rob's declaring multi-device bankruptcy.

episodes.title: Being a regular
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob makes fun of a friend of because he's relentlessly focused and totally impossible to distract, then realizes that he's actually very successful and happy because of these very traits, which is often the way it is with people we make fun of.

episodes.title: Explode
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Pretty much every entertainment device since the magic lantern, since cave people sitting around a campfire, got hot, was dangerous, and could explode. The Samsung Galaxy 7 fits in a long tradition.

episodes.title: Someone else's money
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What would it be like to have your own magical and always-full ATM?  Sort of the way Time Warner must feel, as it approaches being bought by AT&T -- a new and endless source of money to spend.

episodes.title: Call you back
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Silence, as we all know, is the most effective and cutting way to raise your voice....

episodes.title: Place to Park
episodes.author: KCRW, KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: This is Rob Long and on today’s Martini Shot I spend most of my time talking about the second most talked-about thing in the entertainment industry, which is, where on the lot do you park? The most talked-about thing is, of course, when did you buy your house, and what did you pay for it.

episodes.title: Bad real person
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob laughs at a couple of very famous people's physical misfortunes, and then feels bad about it because he's told they're real people, which is something he often forgest, because he's not totally convinced it's true.

episodes.title: Is that out?
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The secret of appearing like an insider: whenever anyone delivers surprising or unexpected news, just sigh and say, "Oh, is that out?"

episodes.title: Damn millennials
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob takes all of those clichés about Millennials and flips them upside down, because A) that's a more accurate picture and B) he doesn't want to anger the young people

episodes.title: Not You
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tries to pace eating his lunch with a friend who is eating his lunch, but then he eats his cookie and Rob gets ice cream. And, yes, there is a metaphor about life in there somewhere.

episodes.title: Friend, Me?
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tells you the exact number of your friends who don't like you as much as you like them. He doesn't tell you who they are. You just have to figure that out for yourself.

episodes.title: Forty Share
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob break his rule and talks politics, just for a moment, and just the only way he can: by talking about show business first.

episodes.title: Hear the News
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tries to step around the nasty arguments on Facebook without stepping in any of them, and still ends up having to scrape some of them off his shoe.

episodes.title: Cos Play
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tries to talk about Comic Con the way it should be talked about -- as a giant promotional event that's all business and no play.

episodes.title: Pokemon
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob shakes his fist at progress like an old, deranged man -- in other words he talks about Pokemon Go, and Hollywood, and how one is going to eat the other.

episodes.title: Flipped Ghostbusters
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob takes a simple, successful movie franchise and extends its financial value by rebooting it, then reversing it -- which means he never has to come up with another original movie idea again.

episodes.title: Characters
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob dresses up as a famous movie character and beats the stuffing out of someone dressed up as another famous movie character, and they keep doing it until they get sued.

episodes.title: Unpopular
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob makes a series of painful confessions surrounding politics, Interstate 40, Hollywood pettiness, and trying to be happy for other people's success. He more or less pulls it off.

episodes.title: The Boss
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob helps actors with their headshots and writers with their pitches and even executives with their office politics. He says to stop worrying about the boss, because the boss is only worried about the boss one level up.

episodes.title: LinkedIn
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob sends you a LinkedIn request to join your professional network and then endorses you for your many skills and then we both get lots of push alerts and notifications and we both wonder why we're on LinkedIn.

episodes.title: Recaps
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob discovers that recaps are a really great way to get out of watching television.

episodes.title: Make It Funny
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob talks about DC and Marvel, Sunni and Shia, and whether cancer can be funny -- all in three minutes. Yes, it's a stretch, but that's sort of the point.

episodes.title: The Marquis
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Some people just like choosing from among available options.

episodes.title: Find It
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob on how hard it can be to direct actors, who are hypersensitive and ego maniacal and in that respect resemble everyone else in your life and on the planet, and that's: make them think it's their idea.

episodes.title: Twitter Bot
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob on Twitter bots, followers for sale, and because it's the law that he cannot be ignored, Donald J. Trump.

episodes.title: Shutting Up
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tells us the best sales technique in the world, which is to make your pitch and then fall silent -- which he has a hard time doing.

episodes.title: Super Fat
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob eats ice cream and bread in front of an actor who needs to lose weight -- and he's not sorry about it.

episodes.title: Other People's Money
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: How losing two million dollars on a show is something to celebrate...for someone else.

episodes.title: Teachers
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Remembering a great teacher.

episodes.title: Starred Changes
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: How the late Andy Grove, of Intel, helped make it easier for executives to give notes.

episodes.title: French Exit
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: You know when you're at a party and you're leaving and you make this long circuit to say goodbye? Don't do it. Do a French Exit. Just walk out.

episodes.title: First Lady
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: There's no not-weird way to say this. Rob asks Nancy Reagan out on a date.

episodes.title: Waze Trail
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob's complicated and probably unsuccessful attempt at comparing the navigation app Waze to his current creative process. . .

episodes.title: Screeners
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob fast forwards through all the screeners he got this year. It's sort of an industry secret.

episodes.title: I Slay
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Today's Martini Shot is all about Beyoncé. Well, it's about Rob and Beyoncé. That came out wrong.  It's about money and Beyoncé.

episodes.title: Hot Costs
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The secret to keeping your production on budget. Just arrange to have your credit card declined.

episodes.title: Touch of Evil
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob wishes he could do what Orson Welles did, which was to shoot ten pages in a night.

episodes.title: Too Clever
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob figures out how to save Al Jazeera America cable news network. Too late, of course, but he does figure it out.

episodes.title: Boat Act
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Is being a Donald Trump impersonator a major career move or a boat act?

episodes.title: 62 Million
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob raises money for his candidate...not really.

episodes.title: Slideshow
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob gets super financial and explains a hedge fund Powerpoint deck.

episodes.title: Chipmunks
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob does what every producer in Hollywood does all the time: complain about the marketing budget.

episodes.title: Spoilers
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob gives away all the secrets to Star Wars and doesn't even say Spoiler Alert.

episodes.title: Spy Movie
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob finds an old spy manual, filled with ways to sabotage any organization, and notices that all of them are in wide use at every major studio.

episodes.title: No Complaints
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Attempting the impossible for a writer in the entertainment business -- to be grateful and uncomplaining.

episodes.title: Homework
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Unsolicited advice to someone who is more famous and successful than Rob, just like a real journalist.

episodes.title: Sell the House
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: A new rule for keeping a TV audience engaged in a show: you just kill all of the good guys.

episodes.title: Listen In
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What every tired and out-of-material stand up comic does: talk about the differences between New York and Los Angeles -- as if there are any.

episodes.title: Too Many Interactions
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob sets up an email to set up a conference call and then a text to remind himself about it and then a call after the call to talk about what happened on the call. It's called "work" but not much work gets done.

episodes.title: Forget the Writer
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Being a writer is a little bit like being a shepherd: it's quaint, people envy the solitude, but no one's afraid of a shepherd.

episodes.title: James Smith
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Why movies succeed and why they fail and why the phrase isn't "The name is Smith. James Smith."

episodes.title: American Graffiti
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: If you've got a political point to make, and you're clever, you can pretty much sneak it into anything.

episodes.title: Presidential Traffic
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob talks about two of Los Angeles' favorite topics: politics and traffic.

episodes.title: Children's Movies
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob discovers that the most immature and impulsive segment of the population are old people who act like teenagers.

episodes.title: The OODA Loop
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Inside the OODA Loop of television development. It's a military thing, which, surprisingly, really applies.

episodes.title: Two Hander
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Why do TV shows have dumpy guys married to beautiful wives, and movies have really old dudes married to young women, but it's never the other way around? Rob senses a marketing opportunity.

episodes.title: Many Meetings
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob attends a meeting to come up with something really new and different. But it's meeting, so that doesn't happen.

episodes.title: It's All Relativity
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob sends a shout out to the bankrupt Relativity Media company. Because a successful movie and an unsuccessful movie both employ the same number of people, so more movies, more better.

episodes.title: Peak Television
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The TV business is like the oil business -- we keep pumping shows out of the ground until there're just too many shows and the price collapses. We need a show business OPEC.

episodes.title: Safe Second
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: It's nice to have options.  This is LA, after all. Things fall apart. Projects collapse. People flake.

episodes.title: Presenting
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What primates do when they present themselves to each other.  It's what we do around here, when we pitch.

episodes.title: Lead
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob turns into the dark anti-hero he's always wanted to be.

episodes.title: First Date
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: On dating and television programming, which are a lot more alike than you'd think, both being complicated, expensive, and futile.

episodes.title: Upgrades
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Going back to a time when Dynasty and Laverne and Shirley were hit TV shows, now known as Empire and Broad City.

episodes.title: Stealing Material
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: With no original material, Rob does everybody else does: he steals from Twitter.

episodes.title: Turn Left Now
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Getting ordered around town by Arnold Schwarzenegger, who turns out to know the very best traffic shortcuts.

episodes.title: The Olive Garden
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Every entertainment executive should work at the Olive Garden for a day. Not exactly, but close.

episodes.title: Open the Gates
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Trying to do the impossible: to enter the gates of a studio and park for a meeting when it's the wrong studio and still maintain a small amount of personal dignity.

episodes.title: Linkly Tied
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What happens in Rob's brain when a pitch meeting goes well, which is that it stops working and says strange, nonsensical things.

episodes.title: Forgot to Laugh
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Wading into the recent controversy about what Jerry Seinfeld said about college kids. That they're insufferable killjoys.

episodes.title: You've Got Nothing
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Explaining why a movie won't work at the box office, right after it hasn't worked at the box office.

episodes.title: The Button
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Using Evernote to prove that the entertainment business is about to get very crazy and very good, especially for writers. This is not a scientific conclusion.

episodes.title: Who Did What
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Breaking the tribal rule that binds all Hollywood writers together, Rob gives credit to a development executive.

episodes.title: Leather Jacket
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob takes a story with the worst and most dysfunctional moral ever, then kind of twists it so it comes out okay.

episodes.title: Change This
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Sometimes when the star makes a demand you give in, sometimes you don’t.

episodes.title: Twitter Horror
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Belated advice to Trevor Noah, and anyone else who suddenly goes from Internet famous to actually famous.

episodes.title: Furiouser and Furiouser
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Furious Seven, Coca-Cola, and how hard it is to change people's favorite things just enough.

episodes.title: Stealing
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The big difference between sampling – where music producers reuse someone else's hook and borrowing, which is what comedy writers do to each others' material.

episodes.title: The Machine that Spins
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob solves the problem of television network programming

episodes.title: Uber but for Meerkat
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Meerkat is the latest amazingly disruptive and revolutionary app that manages to, basically, recreate 1950's live television.

episodes.title: Liberation Theory
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The last place that might believe the characters from the show Friends could afford that apartment -- North Korea.

episodes.title: What Can I Get You?
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Next time Rob heads into in a pitch meeting and someone asks if they can get him something to drink, he's going to say yes.

episodes.title: Need an Ending
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What you do when you suddenly wonder what your life is all about. You do what studios do when they're making an expensive movie and they don't like the ending. They stop production and figure it out.

episodes.title: Let's Get Entrepreneurial
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The new and exciting directions the entertainment business is going in – a more disruptive and entrepreneurial way of doing business. And all of those words mean only one thing: the writer's not getting paid.

episodes.title: You're Fired
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Getting fired, firing someone, and Rob's personal choice, just passive-aggressively ignoring them until they stop appearing in his line of sight.

episodes.title: On Fleek
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob's totally on fleek. And if you have to ask what that means, don't bother.  No one will be saying it in a week or so.

episodes.title: Play One on TV
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Sometimes really excellent actors have a hard time knowing the difference between things that happened to them in real life and on screen. News anchors, too. Not unrelated.

episodes.title: Botoxing History
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What the producers of the movie Selma do to historical fact as "giving history a little face lift and tummy tuck."

episodes.title: Needs the Money
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: The worst way to sell someone on anything is to assume that they need it. No one wants to hear that.

episodes.title: Cold Day
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: A change of venue – and a change in climate – can boost your creativity. It can, but it can also freeze your hair.

episodes.title: Faking It
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: What do you do when you want to take charge but don’t know, exactly, what you’re talking about?

episodes.title: To Don't List
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob rings in the new year with a To Don't list, which is like a To Do list -- but the opposite.

episodes.title: Call Me to Discuss
episodes.author: KCRW, Rob Long
episodes.summary: Rob tell you the four words you need to have a happy and safe 2015.  Four words that can save you a lot of trouble.
